segments.text: Hey , Ben ... did you catch the game last night ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Um ... and what sport are we talking about here ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh ... football . Football is cool . I usually try to catch the World Cup finals .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , I'm talking about American football . The World Cup is soccer .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , I understand . I can't say I'm a big fan . I'm from China , and football doesn't have a really big following over there .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: So Chinese people prefer soccer or basketball ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , I think so . But to be perfectly honest , I'm not really a sports nut.When I was in high school I played on the school volleyball team . Are you a diehard football fan ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , certainly . I wouldn't miss a game for the world . My girlfriend says I have an addiction . And actually , if I had to choose between her and my games ... I'd probably pick football .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It seems Americans are very passionate about sports . Is this just a part of your culture ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , yeah ! I think the love of sports starts when kids are very young . Americans come from many different backgrounds so I guess sports are something we can all enjoy together .
segments.speaker: S1
